speaker: Michael
text: MYTH: All vegetables are healthy at any age.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: REALITY: These five can accelerate dementia after sixty.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: And the worst one? You probably ate it this morning.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Margaret was sixty-eight... sharp as a blade, ran her own accounting firm, never forgot a birthday or a client meeting.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: What happened to her?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: She read an article about "superfoods for aging brains" — so she started drinking green smoothies every morning... kale, spinach, cucumber, the works. Thought she was doing everything RIGHT.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: And?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Five years later, at seventy-three... early onset dementia. She couldn't remember her grandchildren's names.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: That's heartbreaking.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Her family was devastated. They asked me: "How? She ate so healthy!"
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: The answer is in those "healthy" vegetables.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: In Japan, we warn seniors: avoid these five vegetables after sixty... or your memory WILL pay the price.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Today we reveal which ones — and WHY your doctor never told you this.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Let's start with the most SHOCKING one.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Vegetable number one: SPINACH.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Wait, wait, wait — spinach?! Michael, that's on EVERY health list for seniors!
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: I know. In America, we call it a "superfood." Doctors recommend it for iron, for vitamins, for everything. But in Tokyo? Hiroshi tells elderly patients: this is brain poison after sixty.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Not an exaggeration.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Here's what's happening at the molecular level... Spinach is absolutely LOADED with oxalates — these are tiny, razor-sharp crystals. Imagine microscopic shards of glass floating in your bloodstream.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: And those crystals... they attack the brain?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Not directly. They bind to calcium in your blood — calcium that was supposed to reach your brain. Without calcium, your neurons can't communicate properly.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Calcium is CRITICAL for synaptic function, yes?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Absolutely! Synapses fire using calcium signals. Block the calcium... synapses misfire... memory formation slows down... and cognitive decline accelerates like a runaway train.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: You know what's fascinating? In Okinawa, where dementia rates are forty percent LOWER than the United States... spinach is almost never served to people over sixty.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Coincidence?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: I stopped believing in coincidences twenty years ago.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Now, people always say to me: "Just cook it! Boiling removes the oxalates, right?"
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Does it?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: No. This is the lie the health industry keeps spreading. Oxalates are heat-stable molecules — you can boil spinach for an HOUR, and those crystals remain completely intact.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: So whether it's raw in a salad or cooked in a soup... after sixty, it's damaging your brain.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Every. Single. Bite.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Vegetable number two is even MORE controversial.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Oh boy...
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: TOMATOES.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Hiroshi, stop right there! Tomatoes are the FOUNDATION of Mediterranean diets — and those people live to be a hundred!
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: True... but there's a critical difference you're missing.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Which is?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Mediterranean elders eat tomatoes COOKED, slowly simmered with olive oil, in small amounts as part of a meal. Americans? They eat raw tomatoes in massive salads, dump ketchup on everything, drink tomato juice by the gallon.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Okay, but what's the actual HARM?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Solanine — a glycoalkaloid toxin that's concentrated in tomatoes. And here's the terrifying part: it crosses the blood-brain barrier.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Once it's IN the brain, what does it do?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: It disrupts acetylcholine production — that's the neurotransmitter responsible for memory and learning. Without acetylcholine, your brain literally can't form new memories.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: That's... that's the same mechanism as Alzheimer's drugs. They try to BOOST acetylcholine.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Exactly! You're taking medications to increase it... while eating tomatoes that destroy it. It's medical insanity.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: In Eastern medicine, you talk about "cold dampness" in the brain from tomatoes, right?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Yes... but you always want the scientific translation.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: I do!
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Cold dampness means tomatoes slow cerebral circulation — blood flow to the brain decreases, especially in elderly people whose circulation is already compromised.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Reduced perfusion... less oxygen, less glucose reaching neurons. That's a recipe for cognitive decline.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Your science just validated two thousand years of Chinese medicine.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: There's a study from Rush University — twenty fourteen — they tracked over fifteen hundred elderly participants for six years.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: What did they find?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Those consuming high amounts of solanine vegetables — tomatoes, peppers, eggplant — showed thirty-seven percent FASTER cognitive decline compared to those who avoided them.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Thirty-seven percent! And doctors STILL recommend tomatoes for "heart health"!
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Because they're obsessed with lycopene — the antioxidant. But they completely ignore the solanine sitting right next to it.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Classic Western reductionism... one good molecule doesn't cancel out the poison.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Now... vegetable number three. This is where people will REALLY fight us.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: I can already feel the angry comments coming...
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: POTATOES.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Michael, STOP! You can't attack potatoes! Mashed potatoes, baked potatoes, French fries — this is AMERICA!
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: And THAT is exactly why American dementia rates are skyrocketing while Japan's remain stable.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Okay... I'm listening. But this better be good.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Potatoes spike your blood sugar FASTER than eating pure table sugar. A baked potato has a glycemic index of ninety-five... table sugar is only sixty-five. Let that sink in.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: So every time someone eats a potato...
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Their blood sugar EXPLODES. And over years of this... it causes insulin resistance, not just in the body, but specifically IN THE BRAIN.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: They call that "type three diabetes," yes?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Exactly. Alzheimer's disease is literally brain diabetes. Your neurons become resistant to insulin... they can't absorb glucose anymore... and they slowly STARVE to death.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: And memory dies first.
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Michael
text: Always. Now here's the myth that drives me CRAZY...
title: dementia_vegetables_p1

speaker: Hiroshi
text: Let me guess — "sweet potatoes are fine because they're healthier"?
title: dementia_vegetables_p1
